question: A thread is a smaller unit of a ________ that runs separately but within it.
One of the main benefits of threads is ________ execution, allowing tasks to run in parallel.
Threads share ________ with their process, reducing memory usage compared to multiple processes.
User threads are managed by the ________ instead of the operating system.
Kernel threads are directly controlled by the ________.
A major drawback of user threads is that if one thread blocks, ________ threads may also stop working.
Kernel threads are more powerful than user threads but have ________ overhead.
In the Many-to-One model, multiple user threads are mapped to ________ kernel thread(s).
The One-to-One model maps each user thread to ________ kernel thread(s).
The Many-to-Many model allows multiple user threads to be mapped to ________ kernel threads.
